title: Behind Boozer, No. 3 Duke stuns No. 1 Michigan

content: Even as the locals staged a protest, the Forest Department staff sedated a tusker said to be responsible for the two deaths, near Beranagodu in Chikkamagaluru taluk.

content: The hostel, coming under the Presidency College, stands on what was once called Chepauk Park, a triangular stretch of land on the west bank of the canal behind Presidency College

title: In Frames: Unearthing the silent splendour of Hoysalas
content: In the rural parts of Hassan, Mandya and Mysuru in Karnataka, overlooked Hoysala-era temples and basadis reveal a thriving medieval kingdom‚Äôs devotion and sculptural mastery; through star-shaped platforms, serene shrines, finely sculpted pillars and quiet stepwells, the Hoysala imagination continues to whisper through stone

title: Five police personnel die in head-on collision between their vehicle and truck in Odisha
content: Five cops died, and three others sustained severe injuries in the deadly collision, in Jharsuguda district on February 22

title: 'Imperils Republic's image': Delhi court blasts Congress' 'shirtless' protest at AI Summit
content: A Delhi court has remanded four Indian Youth Congress workers to five-day police custody, deeming their protest at the AI Impact Summit-2026 a "blatant assault on public order" that harmed India's diplomatic image. The activists wore provocative T-shirts, chanted slogans, and assaulted police personnel, raising concerns about potential external conspiracies and absconding associates.

title: Hara-kiri at Pallekele! Sri Lanka batters surrender meekly; England win by 51 runs
content: Phil Salt‚Äôs sublime 62 laid the foundation for England‚Äôs commanding win before Sri Lanka‚Äôs batting imploded spectacularly in Kandy. After their bowlers restricted England to a below-par 146, Sri Lanka collapsed in a heap, undone by reckless shot selection and relentless pressure from England‚Äôs attack, led by Will Jacks and Jofra Archer.

title: When Steve Jobs told Apple employees during a townhall: Nike sells shoes, and yet ...
content: Steve Jobs, upon his return to Apple in 1997, found inspiration in Nike's marketing to revitalize the brand. He emphasized that marketing should focus on values and what a company is about, not just product specifications.

title: 'Mom, he will kill me today': Mother recalls chilling last call in Tripura teen assault case
content: A 19-year-old student from Tripura was allegedly confined, assaulted, and raped by her live-in partner in Gurugram. Her mother and lawyer claim she endured prolonged torture, including being burned and cut, with attempts on her life. Police are investigating the serious allegations.

title: Two sisters found dead in Jodhpur on wedding eve; no suicide note recovered
content: Two sisters, Shobha (25) and Vimla (23), were found dead at their Jodhpur home on Friday, just a day before their scheduled weddings.  They were rushed to a hospital around 4 am after their health suddenly deteriorated, but were declared dead on arrival. Preliminary investigations suggest poisoning, with the post-mortem report to confirm the exact cause.

title: FBI warns of ATM jackpotting incidents across US: What are they, how they work
content: Cybercriminals are increasingly targeting ATMs with 'jackpotting' malware, forcing machines to dispense cash without legitimate transactions. The FBI warns of a surge in these attacks, with significant financial losses reported. Threat actors exploit physical and software vulnerabilities, bypassing security to gain direct control and trigger rapid cash withdrawals, often leaving ATMs unexpectedly out of service.

title: Iran-US tensions: Tehran takes Hezbollah's reins, 'week' away from having bomb-grade uranium
content: US envoy Steve Witkoff warns Iran could be a week from producing bomb-grade uranium, despite past strikes.  Washington remains concerned about Tehran's nuclear ambitions, with US President Donald Trump demanding "zero enrichment" but reportedly considering limited, verifiable civilian enrichment. Domestic protests in Iran are also a factor in US policy.

title: 'Nation knows your true form': PM Modi shreds Cong's 'dirty, naked politics' at AI event
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Congress party for its "shirtless" protest at the AI Impact Summit, calling it "dirty and shameless" politics. The protest by Indian Youth Congress workers, who wore T-shirts with the slogan "India-US Trade Deal Compromised," drew widespread condemnation, including from allies. Four IYC workers were sent to police custody.

title: Zoho founder not pleased with Sam Altman's comments on humans? What OpenAI chief said
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman defended AI's energy use by comparing it to human development, but Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu disagreed, advocating for technology to recede into the background. Vembu also likened large tech companies to the East India Company due to their immense financial power and operational scale.

title: Fasting during Ramadan: Experts suggest how people with diabetes can manage fasting window
content: Ramadan fasting can be a feasible option for many people living with diabetes, but it demands detailed planning, guidance from a healthcare professional, and vigilant monitoring. Specialists recommend altering medication schedules, opting for slow-release foods during Suhoor, and maintaining portion control during Iftar.

title: I came in search of jinns, but the haunting was disappointing: A tale from Delhi‚Äôs Jamali Kamali
content: A travel writer ventured to Delhi's Jamali Kamali Mosque and Tomb, drawn by tales of hauntings. Instead of spectral encounters, the writer found a serene, historically rich monument marred by modern vandalism. The experience revealed a profound human element, with the silence and beauty overshadowing any supernatural whispers, prompting reflection on how history is misinterpreted.

title: 'Don‚Äôt think PCB chief has given full freedom': Mohsin Naqvi under fire
content: Manoj Tiwary criticised PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, saying a lack of clarity and freedom may be causing tension between Pakistan‚Äôs coach and captain after Salman Agha‚Äôs bottle-throwing incident. He claimed it showed a trust deficit in the team setup. However, coach Mike Hesson dismissed rift rumours, saying Agha was frustrated with his own dismissal and the discussion was about batting plans, not an argument.

title: Matthew Tkachuk denies ‚Äòpsychological warfare‚Äô claims vs Sidney Crosby
content: Matthew Tkachuk made it clear Team USA will not rely on mind games against Sidney Crosby ahead of the Olympic gold medal clash with Canada. Instead, the Americans are leaning on discipline, depth, and belief after a strong semifinal win. With Crosby‚Äôs status uncertain and Canada still dangerous, the final will test Team USA‚Äôs composure and championship readiness.

title: Who is Pernille D√∏svik? Inside Johannes Kl√¶bo‚Äôs fianc√©e and love story
content: Johannes H√∏sflot Kl√¶bo is one of the biggest stars in winter sports. The Norwegian cross-country skier has dominated the Olympics and World Cup circuit for years. Off the snow, his personal life has also drawn attention. Kl√¶bo is engaged to Pernille D√∏svik, a young professional from Trondheim. The couple confirmed their engagement in June 2025 after several years together. Fans often see her supporting him during competitions and training periods.

title: Connor McDavid and wife Lauren Kyle McDavid combined net worth 2026
content: The success of the professional career of Connor McDavid and his wife, Lauren Kyle McDavid, is reflected in the financial empire they have created. Whether it is McDavid and his lucrative Edmonton Oilers contract and endorsement book or the growing design and hospitality businesses of Lauren, the two have a combined net worth in 2026 that can be seen as a wise investment, brand strength and long-term excellence on and off the ice.

title: 'Teach them a lesson': Karni Sena warns filmmakers over films ‚Äòtargeting‚Äô Sanatan Dharma
content: Kshatriya Karni Sena chief Raj Shekhawat issued a stern warning to filmmakers, threatening to confront them at their homes in Mumbai over movies allegedly targeting "Sanatan Dharma" and hurting religious sentiments. The group specifically objected to "Yadav Ji Ki Love Story" and "Ghooskhor Pandat," accusing filmmakers of disrespecting faith and social groups.

title: KC-390 Millennium: Embraer pitches Nato favorite for IAF deal, eyes India production hub
content: Brazilian firm Embraer is vying for a major Indian Air Force contract, proposing its KC-390 Millennium as the superior choice for around 80 medium transport aircraft. The company plans to establish India as its Asia-Pacific production hub if selected, highlighting the jet-powered aircraft's speed, payload, and operational cost advantages over competitors like the C-130J.

title: 'Russia suffering 1,000 casualties per day, 80% from drones': Sunak after meeting Zelenskyy
content: Drones have become the defining weapon of the conflict, fundamentally reshaping how battles are fought. Defence analysts note that relatively cheap unmanned systems can now destroy extremely expensive targets such as tanks, ships and strategic bombers at a fraction of the cost. A recent Sunday Times defence analysis highlighted how Ukrainian drone strikes have destroyed high-value Russian military assets deep inside its territory, exposing vulnerabilities once thought impossible to exploit.

title: Hardik Pandya gifts ex-wife Natasa a luxury car worth Rs 4 crore, poses with son Agastya - PICS
content: Hardik Pandya and ex-wife Natasa Stankovic continue to co-parent son Agastya with maturity. He recently gifted her a black Land Rover Defender worth around Rs 4 crore. Natasa posed happily with Agastya and the SUV, while Hardik also moves ahead with his new relationship with Mahieka Sharma.

title: ‚ÄòWill not suffer any harm‚Äô: Congress plays down Bhupen Borah's BJP switch ahead of Assam polls
content: Assam's Opposition Leader Debabrata Saikia downplayed former state Congress chief Bhupen Kumar Borah's defection to the BJP, stating it won't impact upcoming elections. Saikia highlighted that local Congress leaders and workers from Borah's constituency remain loyal, assuring no significant harm to the party's prospects. Borah, after 32 years with Congress, officially joined the BJP on Sunday.

title: Nearly 300 drones, 50 missiles: Russia unleashes massive overnight assault on Ukraine
content: Russia unleashed a massive overnight missile and drone assault across Ukraine, claiming one life in the Kyiv region and damaging southern energy infrastructure. Ukrainian forces reported intercepting a significant portion of the incoming projectiles. Meanwhile, a separate explosion in Lviv resulted in one fatality and multiple injuries, with authorities stating it was unrelated to the Russian attacks.

title: 'Babar has found himself a little bit behind': Pak star‚Äôs struggles explained
content: Babar Azam has struggled in the T20 World Cup, scoring 66 runs in four matches and being moved to the middle order. Faf du Plessis supported coach Mike Hesson‚Äôs decision, saying modern T20 cricket demands much higher strike rates in the powerplay. He added Babar still has value on slower pitches in the middle overs. Pakistan next face England in a crucial Super 8 match.

title: 'So it's a loss then?': Moment Trump learnt of US top court's tariff blow mid-meeting
content: Supreme Court dealt a significant blow to President Trump's global tariff policy, striking it down in a 6-3 decision. Trump, reportedly seething, called the ruling a "disgrace" and "unpatriotic," criticizing even his own appointees. This marks a major policy reversal for the administration, potentially forcing a new legal strategy for future tariffs.

title: From Rafale to Tejas: IAF gears up for full-spectrum air power display at Vayushakti-26
content: The Indian Air Force will conduct Exercise Vayushakti-26 on February 27, 2026, at Pokhran to showcase its operational capabilities, including long-range precision strikes and multi-domain operations. The exercise will highlight indigenous platforms and the IAF's role as a first responder, demonstrating its ability to win future conflicts and reinforce national security.

title: Indian Coast Guard detains Iranian-crewed vessel; smuggled cigarettes worth crores seized
content: The Indian Coast Guard has intercepted a suspicious foreign vessel inside India‚Äôs Exclusive Economic Zone, around 115 nautical miles west of Dwarka. The boat, identified as Al Mukhtar, had four Iranian crew members and was found carrying 200 cartons of smuggled foreign-brand cigarettes. The vessel has been taken into custody.

title: Dalal Street watch: What to expect on Monday as Trump raises tariffs to 15%
content: Dalal Street faces renewed uncertainty as US President Trump increased global import tariffs to 15%, just after the Supreme Court struck down his earlier program. Investors are concerned about the unpredictability of trade tensions, despite expectations that the current rate may be temporary. This development adds to existing pressures on Indian equities from Fed policy and weak IT stocks.

title: Rajpal Yadav credits wife Radha for standing by him during cheque bounce case
content: Following his release from Tihar Jail on interim bail, veteran actor Rajpal Yadav has broken his silence regarding his ongoing legal battle. The comedian, who secured temporary relief in a cheque bounce case after depositing Rs 1.5 crore, expressed profound gratitude to the film fraternity and fans for their support during this challenging period. Ahead of his next court hearing on March 18, 2026, Yadav specifically highlighted  the vital role of his wife, Radha, in anchoring their family. While adhering to court conditions, including the surrender of his passport, the actor has promised a comprehensive press conference to provide legal context and finally present "his side of the story" to the public.

title: 'Dangerous tactic': Ex-India cricketer questions Surya's slow scoring rate
content: Sanjay Manjrekar has voiced concerns over Suryakumar Yadav's cautious batting approach in the T20 World Cup, suggesting it hinders finishers like Hardik Pandya. While acknowledging Suryakumar's adaptability against the USA, Manjrekar believes the captain has since become overly conservative, potentially risking India's scoring potential, especially when setting or chasing large totals.

title: PM Modi flags off India‚Äôs fastest metro and Namo Bharat RRTS ‚Äî routes, speed and benefits explained
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Meerut Metro and Namo Bharat services in Uttar Pradesh, dedicating development works worth Rs 12,930 crore. The 82 km Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat Corridor, designed for speeds up to 180 kmph, enhances regional connectivity. The Meerut Metro, operating on the same infrastructure, is set to become India's fastest metro network.

title: Red Fort, temples on radar? 8 suspects with Bangladesh, Pak links held for plotting terror attack
content: Eight individuals with alleged links to Pakistan's ISI and Bangladesh-based extremist groups were apprehended in Tamil Nadu and West Bengal. Intelligence reports indicated a potential terror plot targeting Delhi's Red Fort and prominent temples. The arrests followed specific inputs about a module planning subversive activities, with digital materials being analyzed to uncover a wider network.

title: Brother vs brother as Morne Morkel and Albie Morkel split loyalties in IND vs SA clash
content: Brothers Morne and Albie Morkel will face off as rival coaches in the T20 World Cup Super 8 clash between India and South Africa. Morne coaches India's bowling attack, while Albie serves as a consultant for South Africa, both aiming for victory despite their family ties. Their childhood backyard rivalries are now amplified on the international stage.

title: Can‚Äôt afford that flight ticket today? Jazeera Airways says 'fly now, pay later'
content: Jazeera Airways has launched a groundbreaking 'Fly Now, Pay Later' option, becoming the first Kuwaiti airline to offer interest-free installment payments for flights. This strategic partnership with deema aims to enhance travel affordability and accessibility for a wider range of passengers. The move signifies a significant step in the region's digital aviation transformation.

title: IDFC First Bank reports Rs 590 crore fraud in Haryana government accounts
content: IDFC First Bank reported a Rs 590 crore discrepancy in Haryana government deposits at its Chandigarh branch, suspending four employees. The bank has initiated a forensic audit and is working with other banks to recover funds. This disclosure follows Haryana's directive for departments to close accounts with specific private lenders due to suspected financial irregularities.

title: RBI‚Äôs new data centre far from seismic risks and cross-border threats ‚Äî where is it?
content: The Reserve Bank of India has established a high-security data center in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, to protect critical financial systems. This strategic location minimizes exposure to cross-border threats and seismic risks, ensuring operational continuity. The facility supports core banking functions and enhances the safety and resilience of India's financial infrastructure.

title: 'Abki baar Trump se haar': Congress targets Centre over Trump tariffs
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh attacked the Centre over the proposed India-US interim trade pact, calling it ‚ÄúAbki baar Trump se haar‚Äù and demanding it be put in cold storage and renegotiated. He warned agri import liberalisation would hurt farmers across states and questioned the deal‚Äôs timing amid US tariff turmoil after a Supreme Court ruling against Donald Trump‚Äôs earlier measures.

title: Ex-CIA agent claims US has decided on imminent strike against Iran
content: Former CIA officer John Kiriakou claimed the US has decided to launch military strikes on Iran within days, citing a source who visited the White House. He said internal divisions exist, with JD Vance and Tulsi Gabbard opposing action, while Marco Rubio backs it, as US forces reposition across the Middle East.

title: ‚ÄòWhy now?‚Äô: Gavaskar questions timing of Super 8 pre-seeding row at T20 World Cup
content: Fans are criticising the T20 World Cup's pre-seeding format, which placed strong group winners in the same Super 8 group. However, batting legend Sunil Gavaskar questioned the timing of this outrage, suggesting logistical complexities for the ICC in a multi-country tournament. He highlighted international travel and accommodation as potential reasons for advance group assignments.

title: Instilling scientific temper and environmental awareness at young age crucial for sustainable future:  M.C. Dathan

title: Posters Threaten Terror Attacks, Kashmiri Pandits Seek Security In J&K
content: Kashmiri Pandits have expressed serious concern over threats by Pakistan-backed terrorist groups after purported terror posters surfaced in the valley.

title: Pak's Jaish Terrorist Who Evaded Endgame 20 Times Among 3 Shot Dead In J&K
content: A most wanted terrorist of the Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed was among three terrorists who were shot dead by the security forces during an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar today.

title: Video: US Sets Up Massive "Air Bridge" To Move Forces Towards Middle East
content: The United States has ramped up the movement of military aircraft towards the Middle East, as negotiations over a potential nuclear deal with Iran remain fragile.

title: Gautam Adani Reviews Projects Worth Over Rs 40,000 Crore In Jharkhand, Bihar
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Sunday visited project sites in Jharkhand and Bihar, reviewing major power investments to the tune of over Rs 40,000 crore, which underscore the conglomerate's expanding presence in eastern India.

title: How Guards Abandoned Posts, Let 20,000 ISIS Affiliates Escape Syria Camp
content: About 15,000 to 20,000 people have escaped from Syria's Al-Hol camp, according to US intelligence agencies.

title: Battle For Purvanchal Votes: Haryana Chief Minister To Campaign In Ludhiana
content: As political activity begins to gather pace ahead of the 2027 Punjab assembly election, the BJP is sharpening its outreach to migrant voters -- particularly the sizeable Purvanchali community settled across the state's industrial towns.

title: Rs 4-Crore Ferrari's Rampage Leaves 3 Injured In Posh Hyderabad Locality
content: Three people were injured in a road accident caused by a Ferrari car in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills on Sunday.

title: Newlywed Couple Was On Way Home, Bride's Ex Lover Kidnaps Her At Gunpoint
content: A newly married woman was allegedly kidnapped at gunpoint by her former lover while returning home with her husband after their wedding ceremony early Sunday morning in Odisha's Bolangir district.

title: 16 SIMs, 8 Phones, 1 Deadly Plot: How Pak-Backed Terror Plot Was Busted
content: The Delhi Police's Special Cell foiled a major terrorist plot in an operation that lasted 10 days. They busted a terror module linked to Pakistan's Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and arrested eight suspects. Seven of them are Bangladeshi nationals.

title: 'Congress Has No Funds To Contest Assam Polls': Ex State Chief Joins BJP
content: The Congress's Assam leadership knows it is going to lose the upcoming Assembly polls and does not even have funds to contest the election, former state Congress chief Bhupen Borah told NDTV right after joining the BJP today.

title: Trump Was In A Meeting During Top Court Tariff Setback. How He Reacted
content: The Supreme Court of the United States struck down Trump's global tariff programme, ruling that he overstepped his authority in imposing the trade measures.

title: While Big Corporations Stayed Quiet, 1 Wine Merchant Took On Trump Tariffs
content: Victor Schwartz keeps a bottle of Chateauneuf-du-Pape for special occasions. On Friday, he finally opened it. Not because of a vintage milestone, but because he beat the President of the United States in court.

title: After Andhra, Karnataka Considers Smartphone Curbs for Students Under 16
content: The Karnataka government is actively considering a proposal to restrict mobile phone use for students below the age of 16, citing growing concerns over social media addiction and its impact on young minds.

title: NASA's Moon Mission Delayed Over Technical Issues, Rules Out March Launch
content: The highly anticipated Artemis 2 mission, lasting about 10 days, will see three Americans and one Canadian fly around Earth's satellite.

title: "You Are Already Naked": PM Modi Slams Congress' Shirtless Protest
content: A group of Youth Congress workers on Friday barged into a hall at the AI Summit, shirtless, shouting slogans against the government over agreeing to a trade deal with the US.

title: "My New Hero": Trump Praises US Top Court Judge For Supporting His Tariffs
content: After the Supreme Court decision, Trump made an unusually personal attack on the justices who ruled against him in a 6-3 vote, including two of those he appointed during his first term, Justices Neil Gorsuch and Amy Coney Barrett.

title: "Best Way To Predict Future Is To Invent It": What Entrepreneur Vishal Sikka Told NDTV
content: Vishal Sikka, founder and CEO of Vianai Systems, discussed the promises and perils of artificial intelligence. In an interview with NDTV's Senior Managing Editor Vishnu Som, the entrepreneur spoke of the need for careful oversight

title: LPG Explodes During Op To Control Fire At Delhi Home, Cops Among 13 Injured
content: An LPG cylinder exploded while fire and police personnel were trying to douse a house fire in northwest Delhi's Majlis Park on Sunday, leaving 13 injured, officials said.

title: Sabarimala Tantri's Bail Raises Questions: Did Investigation Lose Direction?
content: The Tantri was arrested by the Special Investigation Team probing alleged irregularities related to gold-plated encasings at the temple.

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S.' first-ever mass start medal, women's freeski halfpipe final postponed
content: The penultimate day at the Olympics felt like the calm before the storm. After Team USA women's ice hockey won gold against Canada in a thrilling match on Thursday, the American men followed up by advancing to the gold medal match by defeating Slovakia on Friday. They'll have a day off before facing Canada in the gold medal match Sunday, the last event of the 2026 Winter Olympics before the closing ceremony. That's not to say there was nothing happening on Saturday. Team USA women's curling fell short in a bronze medal match against Canada, and Mia Manganello won a bronze medal in the mass start, the U.S.'s first medal in that event. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Follow live with the best events from Saturday below.

title: X factors, key players to watch and picks for the USA-Canada gold medal game
content: the top-seeded team from canada will take on the no. 2 seed united states of America (8:10 a.m. ET) it has all come down to one game for ultimate glory in the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament . the winner gets Olympic bragging rights for the next four years .

title: With Mike Evans declining retirement, where do he and the Bucs stand?
